39 int MAX_ROBOTS;
40 int NUM_ROBOTS; // total number of playing robots in the team including self
41 int NUM_SENSORS_PER_ROBOT; // SENSORS include odometry, each feature sensor like
42 // a ball detector, each landmark-set detector and so
43 // on. In this case for example the number of sensors
44 // are 3, 1-odometry, 1-orange ball, 1-landmarkset.
45 // Usually this must co-incide with the number of
46 // topics to which each robot is publishing its
47 // sensed information.
48 int NUM_TARGETS; // Number of targets being tracked. In omni dataset, only one
49 // target exists for now: the orange ball. This may be improved
50 // in future by adding the blue ball which can be seen the raw
51 // footage of the dataset experiment
52 std::vector<bool> PLAYING_ROBOTS; // indicate which robot(s) is(are) playing
53 
54 // Empirically obtained coefficients in the covariance expression. See (add
55 // publications here)
56 
57 // coefficients for landmark observation covariance
58 float K1, K2;
59 
60 // coefficients for target observation covariance
61 float K3, K4, K5;
62 
63 float ROB_HT; // Fixed height of the robots above ground in meters
64 int MY_ID; // Use this flag to set the ID of the robot expected to run a certain
65 // decentralized algorithm. Robot with MY_ID will be trated as the
66 // self robot running the algorithm while the rest will be considered
67 // teammates. Note that in the dataset there are 4 robots with IDs
68 // 1,3,4 and 5. Robot with ID=2 is not present.
69 
70 // Initial 2D positons of the robot as obtained from the overhead ground truth
71 // system. The order is OMNI1 OMNI2 OMNI3 OMNI4 and OMNI5. Notice OMNI2 is
72 // initialized as 0,0 because the robot is absent from the dataset.
73 // This initialization will work only if the node startes befoe the rosbag of
74 // the dataset. Obviously, the initialization below is for the initial positions
75 // at the begginning of the dataset. Otherwise, the initialization makes the
76 // odometry-only trajecory frame transformed to the origin.
77 std::vector<double> POS_INIT;
78 
79 int N_PARTICLES;
80 int N_DIMENSIONS;
81 
82 bool USE_CUSTOM_VALUES = false; // If set to true via the parameter server, the
83 // custom values will be used
84 std::vector<double> CUSTOM_PARTICLE_INIT; // Used to set custom values when
85 // initiating the particle filter set
86 // (will still be a uniform
87 // distribution)
88 
89 // for ease of access
90 std::vector<pfuclt_aux::Landmark> landmarks;
